description: Redevelopment of the existing property to accommodate four self-contained residential units; incorporating part single storey rear/side extension, part three storey rear extension, alteration of roof from hip to gable end; rear roof extension and installation of three rooflights to front roofslope with associated amenity space, cycle and refuse storage.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s); 17006/01-E,  17006/02-E, 17006/03-C, 17006/04-C, 17006/05-E, 17006/06-E, 17006/07-E & 17006/08-A, received 09/10/2017
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2015) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Ensure refuse and recycling storage are provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2015).
| A minimum of seven cycle parking spaces shall be provided and located in a secure undercover lockable compound, prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with policies 1.1 f of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Noise mitigation measures, with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided, shall insulate the new dwellings against the transmission of externally generated road traffic noise, to meet the minimum internal ambient noise criteria as specified in Table 4 of BS 8233:2014; Living Rooms, Bedrooms = 35 dB LAeq, 16 hours; Kitchens, Dining Rooms, Bathrooms = 40 dB LAeq, 16 hours during day-time hours (07:00 - 23:00) and Bedrooms = 30 dB LAeq, 8 hours during night-time hours (23:00 - 07:00).  The Mitigation Measures shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the residential unit and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in the interest of future occupiers, in accordance with policies 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| The rating noise level emitted from the external plant and machinery at the development, as assessed under BS4142: 2014, will not exceed the existing background sound level, as measured at the nearest noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in the interest of future occupiers, in accordance with policies 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to commencement of development details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval, for details of mitigation measures to control the release of asbestos fibres in accordance with Control of Asbestos Regulations 2012.  A report that demonstrates the completion of measures identified in the asbestos remediation scheme shall be produced and submitted to the LPA for approval.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in the interest of future occupiers, in accordance with policies 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
